intro: Euphrasia campestris, commonly known as the field gentian, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and roadsides. The plant features whorled leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is part of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or yellow flowers. Euphrasia campestris is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of the early successional stages in grassland ecosystems.
